page.title: 19CURRENT AFFAIRS 1985
page.content:
Whilst we have been working on the Domesday Project, a number of local issues have been in the national headlines:
1. Is there a need for a second Severn crossing? The Severn Bridge is constantly in need of repairs, and frequently causes traffic congestion.
2. There has been an increase in the toll for crossing the Severn Bridge, and the new charge of 50p for cars has caused much controversy.
3. Should there be a Severn barrage to generate electricity from the strong tides in the estuary? If one is built, could it be combined with a road crossing of the river?
